text:
Hi Community,

Is this a bug? I notice when using personalization tokens it is not populating the form with all the information that should be pass to it:<https://share.vidyard.com/watch/s63yJY3eu1TPXLMw44JU82>

It looks like in the link you are trying to do `contact.HubSpot_owner_id.reference_code` when I _think_ it should just be `contact.reference_code` I suspect that’s is in the email body, but I could be wrong

wondering if ya'll use any email template generators outside of HubSpot? I am looking into things like mjml to do the heavy lifting of markup generation, but woindering what other workflows might be out there...
Also noticed postcards dnd gui, but if I don't have to spend $$ and I can code....
I have our own templates/modules saved outside of HubSpot, and use those. I prefer to code my own as often frameworks just add bloat and are limited in their customization.
I've been liking MJML lately, but there is a definite learning curve
Still the best rule of thumb: if the design is too complicated, it should probably be a simple email with a CTA to a page.

Before I started at HS I did a few projects in MJML. As Mark states. there’s a learning curve.

It works well though, and the community around it seems pretty active.
+1 for MJML. Switched from Foundation for Emails.
